meanings.definition: To rub or wear away by friction.
meanings.sent1: The rough rope chafed against his skin during the climb.
meanings.sent2: She chafed the wood with sandpaper to smooth it out.
meanings.sent3: The cat chafed against the door, wanting to go outside.
meanings.sent4: The constant criticism chafed at his self-esteem.
meanings.sent5: The old key had chafed edges from years of use.

meanings.sent1: The loud noise chafed her nerves.
meanings.sent2: His arrogant attitude chafed his coworkers.
meanings.sent3: The persistent fly chafed the picnic attendees.
meanings.sent4: The repetitive music chafed at her patience.
meanings.sent5: The constant interruptions chafed his concentration.

meanings.definition: To become sore or irritated from rubbing.
meanings.sent1: Her skin chafed from the rough fabric of the new dress.
meanings.sent2: His feet chafed after walking in ill-fitting shoes.
meanings.sent3: The tag on his shirt chafed against his neck all day.
meanings.sent4: The wet clothes chafed her skin during the hike.
meanings.sent5: The tight bandage chafed the patient's arm.
